summary: The Guidance Clarity Act (H.R. 2409) mandates that federal agencies include a "guidance clarity statement" on all guidance documents issued under 5 U.S.C. § 553(b)(4)(A). This statement clarifies that the document does not have the force of law and aims to provide clarity on existing laws and policies. The Office of Management and Budget (OMB) is required to issue guidance for implementation within 90 days of the Act's enactment.
